page.title: 02Houses in Kirk Bramwith.
page.content: Kirk Bramwith has 15 houses,3 are tied to employment:Church cottage for care- taker,bridge keeper's house,Dun Drainage employees house. 12 are privately owned.The rectory is Victorian,the manor house dates from 17th century.There are four 18th century cottages,one is still without electricty,hot water,toilet or bathroom.Two late 19th century houses modernised and cement rendered. One detached brick house_slate roof, built 1938,one detached house built 1965,one bungalow built 1970,two detached houses_cement rendered psuedo_Georgian_1972. All houses front onto village street,there are four streeet lights, no main drains all houses have cesspools.This pattern of houses is similar in neighbouring hamlets.
